pages.text: Pterygotus was a giant predatory eurypterid, it possessed appendages in the shape of a paddle, so it probably swam around, hunting for prey. It had enlarged cheliceral claws that would have allowed it to grasp prey, and it had visual acuity similar to modern predatory arthropods. Its tail also exhibited the adaptations of a swimmer, like shrimp.
